operations_history.operation: Night raids on Castel Benito airfield

sources: Wikipedia - 12th Operations Group (squadron organization, deployment timeline, Egypt operations)
Wikipedia - 82nd Operations Group (historical lineage, unit designation)
Army Air Corps Museum - 12th Bombardment Group (DUC citation, base locations, operational timeline)
12bg.org - 82nd Bomb Squadron (unit personnel archive, squadron composition)
B-25 History Project - B-25C-NA specifications (production blocks, serial numbers, service entry)
B-25 History Project - B-25D-NC specifications (production blocks, serial numbers, Kansas City production)
USAAF Combat Operations - August 1942 (arrival dates, first mission details)
USAAF Combat Operations - December 1942 (movement to Gambut, Libya)
National WWII Museum Digital Collections (photographic evidence of B-25s in North Africa 1942)
metadata.notes: Unit arrived RAF Deversoir, Egypt on 2 August 1942 (with 81st Squadron and Group HQ). First mission scheduled 16 August 1942 bombing Mersa Matruh tank repair facilities. Moved to Gambut, Libya 5 December 1942. Earned Distinguished Unit Citation October 1942-August 1943. Commander name not found in available sources for 1942-Q4. Aircraft variants confirmed as B-25C-NA (Inglewood production) and B-25D-NC (Kansas City production) based on production timeline and deployment dates. Specific tail numbers not available. Personnel numbers based on standard USAAF medium bombardment squadron organization (250-300 enlisted ground crew, 15-20 officers, plus aircrew at 2 crews per aircraft ratio). 82nd Squadron stationed at Deversoir distinguished it from 83rd/434th Squadrons at Ismailia (15 miles apart on Suez Canal).
metadata.witw_validation: WITW _airgroup.csv database not found in sources directory. Unable to cross-reference squadron ID.

tier_1_sources_used: B-25 History Project (production specifications with serial numbers and block details)
Army Air Corps Museum (official USAAF records)
tier_2_sources_used: USAAF Combat Operations chronology (official daily operational summaries)
source_validation.corroboration_notes: Aircraft variants (B-25C-NA, B-25D-NC) verified through Tier 1 source (B-25 History Project) with production dates (B-25C-5-NA serial 42-53332 to 42-53493, B-25C-10-NA serial 42-32233 to 42-32382 available by mid-1942). Arrival date (2 August 1942) and base location (RAF Deversoir) confirmed by Tier 2 source (USAAF Combat Operations August 1942 chronology). First mission date (16 August 1942) and target (Mersa Matruh) confirmed by multiple sources including 12bg.org and USAAF Combat Operations. Battle participation (Alam Halfa, El Alamein) corroborated across multiple sources. Squadron organization and personnel numbers based on standard USAAF medium bombardment squadron structure. Distinguished Unit Citation confirmed by Army Air Corps Museum (Tier 1).
research_gaps: Specific aircraft serial numbers assigned to 82nd BS
Christopher Shores Mediterranean Air War volumes not accessible
USAAF official combat reports not found online
Tail number markings for 82nd Squadron (434th used 70-89 range)
